value.title: Power BI Report Server   Power BI On Premises Hosting
value.excerpt: Power BI is not only a cloud-based reporting technology. Due to the demand for some businesses to have their data and reporting solutions on-premises, Power BI also has the option to be deployed fully on-premises. Power BI on-premises hosting is called Power BI Report Server. This post concerns using

value.title: What is Power BI Dataflow and Why you should use it
value.excerpt: Dataflows are an important component in the Power BI architecture. Using them can enhance the development and maintenance of your Power BI solution significantly. However, there are many Power BI implementations that are not using this functionality, even though it is already more than three years passed

value.title: Different options to model many to many relationships in Power BI and Tabular
value.excerpt: There are two options to model many-to-many relationships using Tabular and Power BI: you can use either a regular bidirectional filter relationship, or a limited unidirectional relationship. In this video, we compare the performance of both options. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt

value.title: Using RELATED and RELATEDTABLE in DAX
value.excerpt: Why and when to use RELATED and its companion function RELATEDTABLE: two common DAX functions that are required when using a row context with relationships. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751669?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Optimize a model forÂ performanceÂ in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: Performance optimization, also known as performance tuning, involves making changes to the current state of the data model so that it runs more efficiently. Essentially, when your data model is optimized, it performs better.

value.title: Use Apache Spark in Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Apache Spark is a core technology for large-scale data analytics. Microsoft Fabric provides support for Spark clusters, enabling you to analyze and process data at scale.

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results. value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
